DIALOGUE BEFORE: Faraday: I'm finishing up some tweaks to the program right now. I'll leave a copy of it for you on my desk when I'm done.
RESPONSE TEXT: Get the program. Use it to break into the memory banks. Got it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: Hopefully you won't have to. We'll keep monitoring the situation. I only want you going in if we have no other choice.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: There's a conflict that's been brewing on this island, shortly after we built Acadia. Between Far Harbor and the Children of Atom.
RESPONSE TEXT: Simply put: They want to kill each other, and each side wants us to help them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Faraday: We've tried to stay neutral, but Far Harbor was going to be wiped out by the Fog, so that's when we built the Condensers for them.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking to the player, who has persuaded DiMA to tell you about what's going on

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: And I was friends with the previous leader of the Children of Atom, Confessor Martin. I even gave them their headquarters, the submarine base they named the Nucleus.
RESPONSE TEXT: Which was a mistake, because Martin is gone and the new Confessor, Tektus, is completely insane.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: He's been threatening us, to force us to choose a side. I left behind something very important in that submarine base I gave them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Faraday: DiMA's earliest memories are stored in the military computer banks in that base. The prewar security systems and Confessor Martin's good will were supposed to keep them safe.
RESPONSE TEXT: But now Tektus is in charge, and he's after DiMA's memories. We don't even know what's in them.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: But we do know that I spent nearly a century on this island, alone. Whatever's in there is too dangerous to allow Tektus to get his hands on them.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: If you're willing to retrieve what I've lost and bring my memories back to me, then we'd all be one step closer to solving this conflict without bloodshed.
RESPONSE TEXT: You'll have to get through the Children of Atom's base. You're new on the island, so you might be able to pose as a recruit.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Faraday: Then once you get to the memory banks, you'll have to use a special program DiMA and I have been working on to break through the security systems.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: We need to accomplish this without bloodshed. Far Harbor and the Children of Atom have a right to exist on this island. The same as us.
RESPONSE TEXT: They're going to kill each other, DiMA. There's no stopping it. We need to pick a side now.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Faraday: Haven't we already picked a side? Building the Fog Condensers around Far Harbor wasn't exactly a neutral act.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: We couldn't stand by and let the people of this island die to the Fog.
RESPONSE TEXT: Just like you couldn't just leave the Cult of Atom without a home? Giving them the submarine base was a mistake.
"The Nucleus", as they're calling it, is basically one big fortified position.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: Far Harbor had cast them out. They have strange beliefs, but they have always accepted us for what we are. And Confessor Martin was a friend.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: Far Harbor had cast them out. They have strange beliefs, but they have always accepted us for what we are. And Confessor Martin was a friend.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well the new Confessor isn't. "High Confessor" Tektus is an unstable megalomaniac and he's going to keep threatening us as long as we're helping Far Harbor.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Faraday: Guys. Can we talk about the elephant in the room? We keep dancing around it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: My old memory banks in the submarine base.
RESPONSE TEXT: I can't believe you never told me about those. I have to wait until they become a security risk.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: I know how it looks in hindsight, but at the time, it was an act of trust. I was honestly more worried they'd accidentally trip the prewar security and get hurt.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: Giving the Children my old home. Allowing them to safeguard my old memories. I thought our people would be working together.
RESPONSE TEXT: *sigh* Just how secure are the banks? How long do we have? And what's in them?
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: I've gone over this before, Chase. I don't know what's in them. That's how it works. It's as close to "forgetting" something as I have.
SCRIPT NOTES: sad that DiMA is always so idealistic, but trying to move back to solving the problem / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DiMA: But I've run some projections of... worst-case scenarios. If we do nothing, and the wrong knowledge falls in the wrong hands...
RESPONSE TEXT: So send me over there. I'll be in and out in a day.
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: We can't risk it. They know you're from Acadia. If you're caught or even seen, then it's war.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Faraday: We should at least prepare her to go in. We're running out of options. I say we tell her how to crack into the memory banks.
RESPONSE TEXT: You've been working on this without me?
DIALOGUE AFTER: DiMA: It came up in a private moment, Chase. But yes, we've been writing a program that will let you access and download my memories.
SCRIPT NOTES: DiMA and Faraday are close and you hate that they leave you out of critical discussions / Irritated

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?
RESPONSE TEXT: No, I'm afraid not.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?
RESPONSE TEXT: You've already done enough. Thank you.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?
RESPONSE TEXT: You're already taking care of it... aren't you?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?
RESPONSE TEXT: Actually...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Never mind.
RESPONSE TEXT: All right.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Tell me about Acadia.
RESPONSE TEXT: DiMA's told you most of what you need to know.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: It's as safe as we can make it, for now. With every new synth we rescue, we're better able to defend ourselves.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So, what's your story?
RESPONSE TEXT: I used to work for the Institute, returning synths that had escaped.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: I was tracking a synth, and instead found DiMA. He... convinced me of the truth, and the error of my ways.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So, what's your story?
RESPONSE TEXT: I used to be a Courser, returning synths that had escaped from the Institute.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: I was tracking a synth, and instead found DiMA. He... convinced me of the truth, and the error of my ways.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: DiMA's told you most of what you need to know.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's as safe as we can make it, for now. With every new synth we rescue, we're better able to defend ourselves.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I used to work for the Institute, returning synths that had escaped.
RESPONSE TEXT: I was tracking a synth, and instead found DiMA. He... convinced me of the truth, and the error of my ways.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: I rejected the Institute, made sure they couldn't track me, and dedicated my life to instead helping synths find freedom.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: I was tracking a synth, and instead found DiMA. He... convinced me of the truth, and the error of my ways.
RESPONSE TEXT: I rejected the Institute, made sure they couldn't track me, and dedicated my life to instead helping synths find freedom.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: I was tracking a synth, and instead found DiMA. He... convinced me of the truth, and the error of my ways.
RESPONSE TEXT: I rejected the Institute, burned my chip, and dedicated my life to instead helping synths find freedom.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: Every synth I've tracked down, every synth convinced to come here, has been assured that he or she will come to no harm.
RESPONSE TEXT: My job is to make sure they all remain safe, no matter what. Understand?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Hey, no argument from me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Good. Glad to hear it.
RESPONSE TEXT: You have DiMA's blessing, so by all means, make yourself comfortable.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: DLC03FemaleChase: You tracked Kasumi here. I'm impressed.
RESPONSE TEXT: Perhaps not as quietly or efficiently as possible, but thankfully she was never in any real danger.
I'm afraid your journey was unnecessary.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I wanted to see for myself that she's safe.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I wanted to see for myself that she's safe.
RESPONSE TEXT: You have my word.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Acadia is a safe haven for synths. Were it not, I would not have aided anyone in reaching it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm not convinced she is safe.
RESPONSE TEXT: By all means, look around. Investigate. We have nothing to hide.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Acadia is a safe haven for synths. Were it not, I would not have aided anyone in reaching it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: And miss out on a fun boat ride? Never.
RESPONSE TEXT: Well then at least you have the return trip to look forward to.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Acadia is a safe haven for synths. Were it not, I would not have aided anyone in reaching it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So, you're saying you could've done a better job of it? Didn't know it was a competition.
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes, absolutely.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Acadia is a safe haven for synths. Were it not, I would not have aided anyone in reaching it.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You have my word.
RESPONSE TEXT: Acadia is a safe haven for synths. Were it not, I would not have aided anyone in reaching it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Every synth I've tracked down, every synth convinced to come here, has been assured that he or she will come to no harm.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: Acadia is a safe haven for synths. Were it not, I would not have aided anyone in reaching it.
RESPONSE TEXT: Every synth I've tracked down, every synth convinced to come here, has been assured that he or she will come to no harm.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: My job is to make sure they all remain safe, no matter what. Understand?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Hey, no argument from me.
RESPONSE TEXT: Good. Glad to hear it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You have DiMA's blessing, so by all means, make yourself comfortable.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That probably won't work out for you in the long run.
RESPONSE TEXT: We'll see. I'm very good at what I do.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You have DiMA's blessing, so by all means, make yourself comfortable.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sounds like a pretty thankless job.
RESPONSE TEXT: I don't do it to be thanked. I do it because otherwise, we'd all be dead.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You have DiMA's blessing, so by all means, make yourself comfortable.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How do you manage to track down synths and bring them here?
RESPONSE TEXT: I... have a network of contacts throughout the area. Some from my time with the Institute, some after.
I know the Institute's tactics, and use that to my advantage.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You have DiMA's blessing, so by all means, make yourself comfortable.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: How do you manage to track down synths and bring them here?
RESPONSE TEXT: That's not a subject we need to discuss. I manage; that's all that matters.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You have DiMA's blessing, so by all means, make yourself comfortable.

RESPONSE TEXT: Acadia will not fall!
You don't stand a chance!
Ungh.
Oof.
Unh.
Agh.
If there's nothing more to say...
Hello?
Is everything all right?
DiMA is waiting for you.
You tracked Kasumi here. I'm impressed.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Perhaps not as quietly or efficiently as possible, but thankfully she was never in any real danger.

RESPONSE TEXT: Did you need something?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to help you all. Is there anything I can do?

RESPONSE TEXT: I don't think this is the way DiMA wanted it, but with Far Harbor and the Nucleus gone, Acadia can be a much safer haven for synths.
If only matters with Far Harbor could've been resolved... differently.
DiMA believes there was no other option, that Far Harbor couldn't be trusted. In the end, I agree with him.
Ultimately I think DiMA is right. The Children of Atom could no longer be trusted, and we are fortunate they're gone.
I'm never pleased to learn of lives lost, but with the Children of Atom gone, Acadia is that much safer.
It would seem that, for now, we can all breathe a little easier.
To have DiMA sacrifice himself, and then see Far Harbor destroyed... I'm not sure this was all worth it.
DiMA never stopped sacrificing for those he swore to protect, right up until the end.
Stay safe. The island is a dangerous place.
Don't stray into the fog if you can help it.
Be careful who you trust.
As a matter of fact, there is. If you're serious about contributing.... well, we've got a situation I need someone to look into.
SCRIPT NOTES: Direct, serious, a military officer / Concerned

RESPONSE TEXT: You've had some experience traveling around the island, so you may be decently equipped to handle it.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Alright, I'm listening.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: PlayerVoiceFemale01: Your missing synth was jumped by cannibal trappers. He didn't survive.
RESPONSE TEXT: That poor bastard. That synth came here to live in peace, and we failed him in the worst way possible.
It's my fault. I should have gone out there to meet him. Damn it all.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: I'm glad you were able to bring some closure to the matter. You deserve this, and... shall we say 200 caps?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: It's my fault. I should have gone out there to meet him. Damn it all.
RESPONSE TEXT: I'm glad you were able to bring some closure to the matter. You deserve this, and... shall we say 200 caps?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sorry things didn't turn out better. I wish they had.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'm sorry things didn't turn out better. I wish they had.
RESPONSE TEXT: You and I both.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.
SCRIPT NOTES: Matter of fact, but sympathetic / Sad

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Just so we're clear, I don't really care about helping you out. I'm in this for the caps, and that's it.
RESPONSE TEXT: I assumed as much. I just wanted you to know that your efforts were appreciated.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Given the risks I took to find your synth, I think I deserve more than that.
RESPONSE TEXT: I suppose that's a fair request. 250 caps, then.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sorry things didn't turn out better. I wish they had.
SCRIPT NOTES: Agreeable, the player has earned the bonus

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Given the risks I took to find your synth, I think I deserve more than that.
RESPONSE TEXT: Fine, 300 caps. I'd advise you not to push your luck any further.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'm sorry things didn't turn out better. I wish they had.
SCRIPT NOTES: Growing cold & aloof, the player is being greedy / Stern

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Given the risks I took to find your synth, I think I deserve more than that.
RESPONSE TEXT: I can do 400 caps, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Don't bother asking for a single cap more.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.
SCRIPT NOTES: Fed up with the player's greed / Stern

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Given the risks I took to find your synth, I think I deserve more than that.
RESPONSE TEXT: The reward is 200 caps. Of course, you'll also have our gratitude. Who knows? That could turn out to be even more valuable.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.
SCRIPT NOTES: Firm, but not angry. You like the player and appreciate his help

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Given the risks I took to find your synth, I think I deserve more than that.
RESPONSE TEXT: I find your greed irritating. I'll give you the 200 caps I originally offered, and as an added bonus, I won't shoot you.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You said this wasn't the first time a synth has gone missing?
RESPONSE TEXT: Of course not. For someone without weapons or field training, crossing this island is deadly.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You and I both.
RESPONSE TEXT: Thanks again for your help. Be safe out there.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Some other time maybe.
RESPONSE TEXT: Fine. Come and see me when you're ready.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: We were expecting a new synth to arrive, and he should have been here by now.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That depends on what you need me to do.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's fair. If I were in your place, I would want as much data as possible.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: We were expecting a new synth to arrive, and he should have been here by now.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Fine. Come and see me when you're ready.
RESPONSE TEXT: We were expecting a new synth to arrive, and he should have been here by now.
There's been no sign of him, and I'm concerned that he might have become lost on the way here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'll find out what I can.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I thought this was your job.
RESPONSE TEXT: Normally it would be, but tensions with the Children of Atom are high right now and I'm needed here to oversee security.
Right now, you're the only option that I have. I'l give you the details, and you can do what you will.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You should start by talking to Brooks in Far Harbor. He's one of us, a synth.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: This island is a deathtrap. Your synth probably ended up as mirelurk food.
RESPONSE TEXT: I certainly hope not, but I'd like to know for certain.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: You should start by talking to Brooks in Far Harbor. He's one of us, a synth.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Right now, you're the only option that I have. I'l give you the details, and you can do what you will.
RESPONSE TEXT: You should start by talking to Brooks in Far Harbor. He's one of us, a synth.
He's the one who meets the new arrivals and gets them started on the journey here.
Of course, he's not likely to tell you anything without proof that you're working for me.
If he doesn't cooperate, tell him that his designation is L7-92. That should convince him.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Chase: That's as much help as I can give you for now. Please hurry. If that synth is out there alone, he won't last long.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Chase: If he doesn't cooperate, tell him that his designation is L7-92. That should convince him.
RESPONSE TEXT: That's as much help as I can give you for now. Please hurry. If that synth is out there alone, he won't last long.
Please hurry and find that synth.
That synth could be out there on his own. I hope you can find him quickly.
This island is no place for a lone synth to get lost.
It'll mean a lot to us if you can find that missing synth.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Dejen: Just wanted to report that the perimeter is all clear.
RESPONSE TEXT: I appreciate that, Dejen, but we've talked about this. You don't need to worry.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: With all due respect, we can never be too safe.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Dejen: With all due respect, we can never be too safe.
RESPONSE TEXT: I suppose not. Thank you.
How is Jule today?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Cog: ...the Hell you askin' me for?

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Cog: ...the Hell you askin' me for?
RESPONSE TEXT: You have been spending a significant amount of time with her lately. I assumed you were close.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Cog: Well, don't assume. You know what they say...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Cog: Well, don't assume. You know what they say...
RESPONSE TEXT: No, I'm afraid not.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Cog: Of course you don't. Just... never mind.

RESPONSE TEXT: I spoke with Dejen. You were outside the perimeter again, Cog.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Cog: "Perimeter?" You mean the wall of junk? Come on, Chase...

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Cog: "Perimeter?" You mean the wall of junk? Come on, Chase...
RESPONSE TEXT: You know the rules, Cog.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Cog: What can I say? Sometimes I'm forgetful. You know how it is.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Cog: What can I say? Sometimes I'm forgetful. You know how it is.
RESPONSE TEXT: Cog, I'm serious. Don't endanger others just because you don't like the rules.
Your trips to Far Harbor have been uneventful, I hope?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: No incidents to report, ma'am.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Dejen: No incidents to report, ma'am.
RESPONSE TEXT: You don't have to call me "ma'am," Dejen. We're all friends here.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: Yes. Right. Sorry.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Dejen: Yes. Right. Sorry.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's all right. You don't have to be sorry either. Just stay safe on your trips.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Dejen: Of course, ma'am. Dammit, sorry.
